data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You go backwards from a step if you stay forward from the starting point. The answer: No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn right, you must first turn left. The starting point is the starting point at a given point with 4 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 6 steps back to the starting point, then you take 8 steps back to the starting point. If you take 4 steps back to the starting point, then you take 4 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you step 5 steps, it takes 7 steps to lead you back to step 7. The answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around; turn right. Turn left; turn right. Take 5 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You don’ t turn left and right, you turn around and take 7 steps. So, you return back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left. Take 9 steps. 8 steps. 9 steps. Yes. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps to go back to where you started. The initial walk was 6 steps. If you turn around, you go back 12 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When someone is facing forward, before you take steps you should always face forward and continue to take steps. If they are facing backwards, you should always face forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 9 steps in one direction you return to the starting point. If you turn around take 2 steps then you can take 7 steps. There are a total of 9 steps. If you take 3 steps and take 3 steps back, you are three steps back. If you take 7 steps and take 7 steps back, you are six steps back. So, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, step one goes forward. Using a forward direction takes one step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

On the direction you are facing forward, you should always always remain facing forward. There will be 6 steps backward taken, so 6 steps are taken backwards. If you take 8 steps right, that means there are 30 steps right. If you take 5 steps left, then there are 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 9 steps left and take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left and take 1 step left. Take 9 steps left and take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps forward and take 1 step left. Take 6 steps left and take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps forward and take 4 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person's direction of travel is always forward in all directions. One's direction of travel is always the opposite of facing forward. So, the answer is no.

If you return from standing, you always have to face forward. The starting point is always facing forward and you always take steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning right and turning around are opposite ways to come back to the starting point. Turning around and back is different ways to come back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Steps backward can be any number from 5 to 5. Steps forward can be Any number from 4 to 4. Steps forward can be Any number from 4 to 2. So, the answer is Yes.

The same instructions can be followed to return to anything in the same way. A turning means to turn at a right angle while taking a right turn means to turn just at the right angle. So, the answer is no.
